content.title: Minu tööd:
content.project_1_content: "Praktikakohviku veebileht"\n2022 sain panna end proovile TalTechi IT Teaduskonna Üliõpilaskogu poolt korraldatud üritusega Praktikakohvik. Olin ürituse peakorraldaja ning veebiarendaja.
content.Praktikakohvik2022: Sain võimaluse olla projekti juht, kes tegeles nii disaini, juhtimise kui ka veebiarendusega. Veebiarenduse kohapealt oli eesmärk luua lihtne ning mugav üheleheline interaktiivne veebileht.\n\nTahtsin panna end proovile ning võtsin esmakordselt kasutusele React JS-i. Kasutades varasemaid teadmisi sain ma HTML ning CSS koodiga hästi hakkama. React pakkus uusi võimalusi koodi puhtana hoidmiseks ja sorteerimiseks. Kasutades Hook-i useContext sain ma mugava viisi veebilehe lokaliseerimiseks. Andmete hoiustamiseks kasutasin JSON faili, kus olid nii inglise- kui ka eestikeelsed terminid. Suureks abiks olid ka useState ja useEffect, millega sai veebilehe interaktiivseks muuta. Lisaks kasutasin JavaScript DOM-i, et muuta HTML elemntide stiile ja sisu.
content.project_2_content: "KG Lan 2019 veebileht & rakendus"\nMinu esimene suur IT projekt oli kui ma tegin oma esimese veebilehe ja rakenduse suurele LAN üritusele, mida ma aitasin korraldada.
content.KGLan2019:
Nagu juba mainisin, oli see minu esimene veebileht. Eesmärk oli kasutada ainult HTML-i ja CSS-i, sest igasugused pistiprogrammid oleksid teinud selle lihtsa staatilise lehekülje keeruliseks ning ma teadsin, et algul tuleb selgeks saada baasoskused.

Alustuseks lõin disaini koos põhi elementidega. Koodi kirjutamisel proovisin kindlate eesmärkide jaoks kasutada õigeid HTML Tag-e ning kirjutada selgeid klassi ja id nimetusi, et CSS oleks kergemini loetav. Kui kood oli valmis, hakkasin lahedaid efekte katsetama (sujuv kerimine, hover/focus).

Rakenduse jaoks kasutasin ma block koodimist MIT App Inventoris. Selleks et otseülekandel näidata rakenduses tehtud muudatusi, pidin leidma viisi, kuidas saada info telefonist .txt faili, kust OBS Stuudio seda loeks. MIT rakendusest oli hästi keeruline infot kuhugi edastada, kuid leidsin selle jaoks huvitava lahenduse. Seade saatis pärast igat muudatust Google Formsiga info Google Sheetsi. Koos Google Apps Scriptiga sain ma kõik Sheetsi andmed puhta tekstina eraldi veebilehele, kus arvutis olev Pythoni skript seda luges ning .txt faili kirjutas.

Selle projektiga sain ma oma nahal tunda, kui oluline on puhta koodi säilitamine. Selle saavutamisel ja hoidmisel oli uute elementide lisamine hästi kerge ja mugav. Lisaks arendas see meeletult minu probleemide leidmise ja lahendamise oskust. Vaadates tagasi näen kui palju paremini ma oleks saanud seda koodi kirjutada.

content.title: My work:
content.project_1_content: "Internship Café Website"\nIn 2022 I got to but myself to the test with an event in TalTech, such as the Internship Café. I was the main organizer and web developer of the event.
content.Praktikakohvik2022: I had the opportunity to be a project manager who was involved in design, management and web development. The goal for the website was to create a simple and convenient one-page interactive website.\n\nFor this website, I wanted to put myself to the test so I used React JS for the first time. Using previous knowledge, writing HTML and CSS went smoothly. React offered new ways to keep the code cleaner and sorted. Using the useContext Hook, I was able to conveniently localize the website. I used a JSON file with both English and Estonian terms to store the string data. UseState and useEffect were also a great help in making the website interactive. In addition, I used the JavaScript DOM to change the styles and content of HTML elements.
content.project_2_content: "KG Lan 2019 Website"\nMy first big IT project was when I made my first website and application for a big LAN event that I helped to organize.
content.KGLan2019:
Like I already mentioned, this was my first ever website that I developed. The goal was to only use HTML and CSS, because plug-ins would have made this simple static page complicated and I had to learn the fundamentals first.

For starters, I created a design with basic elements. When writing the code, I tried to use HTML Tags for their correct purpose and write clear class and id names to make the CSS easier to read. When the code was ready, I started experimenting with cool effects (smooth scrolling, hover/focus).

For the application, I used block coding in the MIT App Inventor. In order to show the changes made on the application appear on the livestream, I had to find a way to get the information from the phone to a .txt file from which OBS Studio would read it. It was very difficult to transfer information from the MIT application, but I came up with a interesting solution. With the help of Google Forms the device sent information to Google Sheets by submitting a form. Along with Google Apps Script, I got all of the Sheets data in plain text on a separate web page where a Python script on my computer read it and wrote the .txt file.

With this project, I learned the hard way why clean code is so important. Maintaining clean code made it convenient and easy to add new elements. In addition, it substantially developed my ability to find and solve problems. Looking back I can see how much better I could have written this code.
